intro: Phytocrene blancoi, commonly known as the Blanco's phytocrene, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
